The Fours
The Chapter on the Spiritual Life of the Holy Ones
Deceit

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha:

original: “Ye keci, bhikkhave, bhikkhū kuhā thaddhā lapā siṅgī unnaḷā asamāhitā, na me te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū māmakā.
analyzed: ye keci bhikkhave bhikkhū kuhā thaddhā lapā siṅgī unnaḷā asamāhitā na me te bhikkhave bhikkhū māmakā
translated: “Monks, those monks who are deceitful, fraudulent, crafty, pretentious, haughty, and not concentrated are not my disciples.

original: Apagatā ca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmā dhammavinayā; na ca te imasmiṁ dhammavinaye vuddhiṁ virūḷhiṁ vepullaṁ āpajjanti.
analyzed: apagatā ca te bhikkhave bhikkhū imasmā dhamma vinayā na ca te imasmin dhamma vinaye vuddhim virūḷhim vepullam āpajjanti
translated: They have fallen away from this Dhamma and Discipline, and they will not attain growth, progress, and maturity in this Dhamma and Discipline.

original: Ye ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhū nikkuhā nillapā dhīrā atthaddhā susamāhitā, te kho me, bhikkhave, bhikkhū māmakā.
analyzed: ye ca kho bhikkhave bhikkhū nikkuhāḥ nillapāḥ dhīrāḥ atthaddhāḥ su samāhitāḥ te kho me bhikkhave bhikkhū māmakāḥ
translated: But those monks who are not deceitful, not fraudulent, not crafty, not pretentious, not haughty, and are concentrated are my disciples.

original: Anapagatā ca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmā dhammavinayā; te ca imasmiṁ dhammavinaye vuddhiṁ virūḷhiṁ vepullaṁ āpajjantī”ti.
analyzed: an apagatā ca te bhikkhave bhikkhū imasmā dhamma vinayā te ca imasmin dhamma vinaye vuddhim virūḷhim vepullam āpajjanti iti
translated: They have not fallen away from this Dhamma and Discipline, and they will attain growth, progress, and maturity in this Dhamma and Discipline.”
The Blessed One said this.
And in this connection it was said:
“Deceitful, fraudulent, crafty, pretentious,
Haughty, and not concentrated,
They do not grow in the Dhamma,
in the Dhamma taught by the One Rightly Self-awakened.
The wise ones, without deceit or flattery,
devoted to the goal, well-composed,
they grow in the Dhamma
in the Dhamma taught by the One Rightly Self-awakened.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.🔽Navamaṁ.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti 🔽navama
translated: This is the meaning of what the Blessed One said. Thus I have heard.
